chargeHist.descr: Identity Theft - Obtain Money or Credit

result.execSummary:
The defendant Rebecca A. Vis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery-Uttering [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Identity Theft - Obtain Money or Credit

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

miscConds.notes: Defendant to pay costs with DNA surcharge within the term of probation. Defendant to pay costs of superivision.

Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with D.L.J., w/f, dob 3/9/60 or T.J.J., w/m, dob 6/27/91.

Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.

Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.
Defendant shall submit a DNA sample if not already recorded/submitted. Court does assess the DNA surcharge.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA Assessment and follow through with any recommendations resulting therefrom.

timeConds.notes:
in Dodge County Jail with Huber and Transfer to be served some time within the 2 years of probation with the agreement of Agent.  Court does not oppose electronic monitoring.
Consecutive to: any other sentence

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
Shall serve 9 months DCJ w/h&t commencing forthwith; Consecutive to any sentence(s) currently imposed.
Huber may be used for treatment purposes.
Consecutive to: with work release and transfer privileges

Status Report from Agnesian

(14CF49, 50 & 53) Defendant Rebecca A. Vis in court, in custody with attorney Annamarie A Wineke.  Gilbert G Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Def. will plead today; Court reviews GPQPA & WOR; Court reviews charges/penalties; Def. pleads NC to Misapp. ID Info. in Count 1 of 14CF49, Forgery in Count 2 of 14CF49 and NC to Forgerty/PTC in Count 2 of 14CF53; parties stip. to facts; Court finds pleas made FV&I and finds Def. guilty of Counts 1 & 2 in 14CF49 and Count 2 in 14CF53 with all other counts D&RI; discussion on amount of restitution; Def. says some were paid back; State heard on recomm.; Atty. Wineke heard; Court imposes sentence

14CF49: Misappro. ID Info. and Forgery
14CF53: Forgery/PTC in count 2
**W/H - 2 years PO
- CC each count
- DNA and surcharge/each
- AODA & FT
- no contact w/D.L.J., w/f, dob 3/9/60 or T.J.J. w/m, dob 6/27/91
- absolute sobriety, no bars, etc.
- no drugs
- Restitution to be determined within 60 days
- in 14CF53: 60 days in DCJ w/H&Tr. to be served some time within 2 years of probation; Court does not oppose electronic monitoring

(14CF49, 50 & 53) Defendant Rebecca A. Vis in court with attorney Annamarie A. Wineke.  Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Review of info is waived; not guilty plea entered; 10 days mtns; stc set; bail con't  Telephone scheduling conference scheduled for April 29, 2014 at 09:00 am.

9:01 - 14CF49,50 & 53 - Defendant Rebecca A. Vis in court with attorney Annamarie A. Wineke.  James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaints and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested within time limits. Prelim set. Court sets bond at $5000 PA bond with conditions:   Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with co-actor Tim Johnson.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 20, 2014 at 10:00 am.
